intro: Macrocarpaea gaudialis, commonly known as the Gaudilis macrocarpaea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often woody at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
